page.title: 08Emmington Farming Methods
page.content: Our block contains 12 farms. They employ very few people. Sheep are not common, most farms being mixed-cereal and dairy produce. Village Farm in Emmington produces 1 million litres of milk per year from 175 cows. The milk is transported to London to be made into yoghourt or for bottling. There are 120 acres of wheat, 16 of barley. The farmer relies heavily on computers and modern methods and produces more milk now than the total previous production of 14 farms in the Chinnor area. Four people are employed. Manor Farm in Emmington is a cereal farm, having only 12 head of cattle. The farmer has no sheep; he just doesn't like them! Cattle are kept for beef. There are 50 acres of barley and the same of wheat. He employs 3 workers.
